answers.answer: Why did you decide to do it?

I had problems with both pregnancies. I had preeclampsia with my first and gestational diabetes with my second and i was absolutely terrified to see what would happen with the next pregnancy. Both my boys were in the NICU after birth. Plus I felt 2 kids was enough for me. I grew up with just me and my sister and to me that has already been the perfect number. Plus kids are just so expensive. I love my two boys. They are my world.
I think there is a time window where you can have it reversed. But I'm not sure.
Well all those reason you just said seem like maybe it was definitely the right reason.  Why are u regretting it.  Cause you just said all the reason why u wanted it

My mom unknowingly had her types tide at 21. Long story, but my biological father decided to talk the doctor into it after my mom gave birth to my younger sister. The doctor (who no longer has a license to practice) had my mom on morphine during her labor with my sister and let her sign papers while drugged up and didn't even explain what was happening. However, once she got remarried to my step dad and decided to have another child but couldn't get pregnant she found out that her tubes had been tied.  She had a reversal and my little brother was born 8 years after her tubes were tied. I believe it was somewhere late 5 years after the reversal. Unfortunately, there is no guarantee that  you will get pregnant after a reversal, but it is an option that could give you the chance to have another if you end up wanting to later on. Good luck with whatever you chose in the future!
I don't think healthcare covers reversals, but if you want more kids and don't want a reversal, have you ever considered adoption? That way you get the kid without any pregnancy issues.
I am just absolutely in love with my little boy I had just last week. I guess it is sinking in that he will be my last. I thank each and everyone of you for your feedback.

I am 27 and had my first child born in Aug 2014. My husband and I said we were fine with no more chikdren..  lol just found out I am 4 weeks pregnant with baby number 2... lol I will be getting my tubes tied this time.

I refuse to get my tubes tied. It is a major surgery and when we decide we are done my husband can go in for a vasectomy it is in office procedure. Less healing time and a lot safer. Plus I had the kids and went through all of that so he can be the one to get fixed.

I think you hit the nail on the head I think you are just going through grieving in a way that you had your last child. Even if you know you made the right decision it doesn't mean you can't second guess what you did based off how you feel now. Just remember the reasons you choose to do it in the first place.
I'm 6 weeks pregnant with my second child and after this baby i'm getting my tubes tied. Most BC don't work for me so it's best to get them tied.

This is my third baby and I'm getting my tubes tied. I'm sure I'll have my moments where I'm sad and regret doing it but I know its what's best for me. To me three kids is plenty there expensive like ubmentioned plus I have to have csections and I know with each complications and risks run higher and its not something I want to risk seeing as this pregnancy has been the hardest on me I can't do it again. Good luck and I hope u feel better soon but know its ok to feel the way u do an based off ur reasons o think u made a good decision.
I think that your history such as if you have a living child and if you have difficulty in pregnancy are bigger factors than age. You have totally legit reasons for having had the procedure.
I am pregnant with our fourth, surprise blessing, my husband will be getting a vasectomy. I told him that I will have pushed 4 beautiful babies into the world, he can get a little snip.

I had a tubal reversal, it is not covered by insurance and there is no gaurentee it will work. We have been fortunate that I was able to become pregnant and we are expecting our 2nd baby post TR surgery. I wish woman/doctors would push for a very permanant birth control. We never know what the future may hold. Spouse may die, divorce, remarriage, or just simply wanting more children once the memory of a difficult pregnancy fades.

My first pregnancy was great the labor was terrifying when I literally almost didn't make it. Having my second, I'm terrified of labor, if you start to have doubt as I am on boy number two and wanted a girl, the risk is too high, be there for your boys and pray for a grand daughter!! Your baby days are far from done but you'll have just as much fun!!

If your tunes are tied I do believe you can have it reversed but if they're burned then no reversal option. Some Doctors will ask you life altering questions while your drugged...they did my sis that way but someone was there to intercept and request they talk to her about it later after she's healed. This should be illegal for them to ask while in this state. Also I thought you have to be 25 to get this procedure done or have your parents consent.
Thank you so much for your encouraging words. I'm starting to feel better about the decision I had made. I will doubt it at times but for health reasons I feel it was the right thing to do.

question: I had my 2nd son via c-section last Thursday. The whole c-section experience was a complete disaster to me. I also had my tubes tied at the same time. I had my first son in 2012 and now I have my youngest son. To some point I feel that I made a mistake getting my tubes tied so young. I am 22. Does anyone else feel the same?
title: Think I made a mistake!!
